column8: text

Nurul conceded that it would be a 'challenge' to introduce a common logo to voters with months to go before polling.Pakatan Harapan parties would have a much easier time campaigning against Barisan Nasional (BN) under one common symbol in the next general elections, Nurul Izzah Anwar said.But the PKR vice-president also conceded that it would be a “challenge” to introduce it to voters with months to go before polling, which must be held by August next year.“I agree that it will be much easier for us to campaign in the rural areas if we use the same symbol.“But we must also remember that, with a new symbol, the challenge is also to introduce it to the voters,” the Lembah Pantai MP was quoted by news portal Malaysiakini telling some 700 people at a fundraising dinner held at the Thean Hou Chinese temple here last night.According to the report, she was responding to a call by former Barisan Nasional (BN) leader-turned-Opposition politician Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad for the allied parties to take a leaf from the ruling coalition’s playbook by using a common symbol.The BN coalition of 13 parties each have their own logo, but compete under the common symbol of a pair of scales in elections.Underscoring the challenge was the Registrar of Societies’ rejection of a common logo submitted by the previous Opposition pact when it was known as Pakatan Rakyat, Nurul Izzah reportedly said.http://www.themalaymailonline.com/malaysia...h.GdHx4eA8.dpuf

1 Corinthians 1:27 (KJV) - But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mightyThere is a reason why God gave me this ministry as I am. The friends that knows me, knew my flaws and yet have no problem getting along with me. The people who don't know me, have reservations about me, I don't blame them.This is not about me. God gave me this ministry to point people who have lost their way to God. How?I'll be the first to admit I'm no leader material. I have my flaws, I still can get angry. I still can be stubborn. Yet I have a relationship with God. The Lord did not reject me. God hears my prayers and still answers them until today. God still speaks to me until today, in fact just this morning around 8am. I still see the Grace of God, his divine favours being poured in life and my families life..being manifested, despite of my imperfection.What is my reason for telling you this?

I wonder what haters of Dr. M propose to save Malaysia right now. There is literally no choice left other than going for Pakatan Harapan.I get that being an Idealist and rejecting gutter politics is attractive, but it is not what we need right now. We need a drastic change and switch to the lesser evil at this exact moment. What else do they propose to do? Keep MO1 in power till the country is destroyed while proudly proclaiming they rejected Dr.M's hypocrisy? Do they feel happy for thinking stuff like "Wow Najib will use same tactic 30 years later so we reject Mahathir to avoid precedents from happening I'm so ethical and just!!!! I'm so proud!!!!" The country and people simply don't have the luxury of having squeaky clean politicians to save us now.Be realistic, is what I would say to those who reject Dr.M for his past mistakes. We get that he destroyed Malaysia in the past, but what choice do we have now? I want those idealists to explain how they propose to defeat the present regime in a country with guillable voters baited by race and religion 24/7 other than relying on the hugely popular Dr.M. Dr. M has immense respect among the Malays. That is a fact that the Opposition needs to embrace. We can worry about them after kicking out BN. Then hopefully new politicans will enter the scene and we have better ones to change in the future generations.Idealism doesn't work in politics especially in 3rd world democracies like our country. Idealism will destroy us sooner by trying to choose angels that simply don't exist in this young country. Without any decent shakeups in the political scene (we have not changed federal government in the history of Malaysia), you won't find the idealistic leaders that you want.

you do realise that is CIA executive summary, one of 13 millions other declassified from their archive, right? it's not like they suddenly wake up and specifically "bothered" to declassify only this particular document.

I don't see it that way, Najip siphoning money is going to effect you and I, all malaysians bcos he's doing at the rate of no shame.your children will be affected.If you think that is something good, I'll say you've lost it.

Ok, so continue with MO1 is your plan to "destroy" the foundation and make the country suffer?What a selfish guy you are. That's why I say idealists like you don't understand that change cannot happen by "starting anew". Everything must have a transition period. You can't change or destroy shit if you reject any efforts to change the status quo.

You must be smoking some good stuff if you think Malays don't support Dr.MPeople like you are not helping the country. I ask again, what do you propose to do if you don't support the opposition? Given that you seem to understand that the current regime is not a good administration. Yet you're afraid of change. Yet you worsen the situation by being dense and rejecting change while lamenting the current situation.

Almost all great countries from ancient Greeks, to Romans, to US all suffer at one point or another. What makes them great is that they build their countries based on a solid philosophy and ideology. It's not my fault that PH can't come out with a better candidate other than Dr.M. They have years to build a momentum following the great upheaval following last 2 election results, and what did they do apart from internal squabbling that fracture the support of people like me that voted for them in the last election?None, zilch, nada. And no, just because people are doubting PH doesn't necessary means that we are throwing back the support to MO1. It means some of us have lost any hope on the political process in this country. We need our version of Trump, not another Dr M.
I don't see how voting for the great Evil that started all this shit is changing the status quo.

TLDR: I am a bigger hypocrite than those politicians I hate. My philosophy and ideology is so great that I lost hope in this country!People like you are selfish. Know how to complain and look up to other countries yet don't want to fight using your own hands and instead giving excuses left and right.Also, citing Trump as an example to change a country lmao. I'm done

So you remain with status quo by maintaining the party that ruled since Merdeka! Great! See your hypocrisy?Changing ruling government also don't dare still wanna talk about philosophy and Greeks and Romans and whatever nonsense.

Sesungguhnya Allah tidak mengubah apa yang ada pada sesuatu kaum sehingga mereka mengubah apa yang ada pada diri mereka sendiri. Dan apabila Allah menghendaki untuk menimpakan kepada sesuatu kaum bala bencana (disebabkan kesalahan mereka sendiri), maka tiada sesiapapun yang dapat menolak atau menahan apa yang ditetapkanNya itu, dan tidak ada sesiapapun yang dapat menolong dan melindungi mereka selain daripadaNya. - Ar-Ra'd 13:11
